lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
2. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Chat/tasks/Evelyn.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Evelyn.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
3. Type the actions you want to do, the commands include follows:
2. *list*: List out all the tasks in your task list.
3. *mark*: Mark the task with the index as done.
4. *unmark*: Mark the task with the index as not done.
6. *deadline*: Add a deadline task with a deadline.
7. *event*: Add a event task with a start time and end time.
8. *delete*: delete a task with a specified index from the task list.
9. *find*: find tasks that contain a keyword.
* Construct a Deadline object that takes in description and time of the task.
* @param description The description of the task of deadline subclass, in string.
* @param by The deadline time of the task, in string.
* Override the toString method from superclass Task so the output can be reformatted.
* @return A string of [TaskType] Description (by: DeadlineTime) is returned.
* Create an instance of Evelyn class.
* If there is a file for data storage, write into the file.
* Or else create a new TaskList.
* Run the application for a Ui.
* Initialise a Parser object in the task list.
* If the user do not key in "bye", enter the loop for continuous command.
* Save the task at the end of commands.
* Show a bye message when exited.
* @throws InvalidIndex if index is out of bound.
* @param args Takes in the command line.
* @throws InvalidIndex If an index is invalid or out of bound.
public static void main(String[] args) throws InvalidIndex {
* Construct a Event class that takes in task description, from time and to time of the evnet.
* @param description The description of the task of subclass event.
* @param from The start time of the event, in string.
* @param to The end time of the event, in string.
public Events(String description, String from, String to) {
*  Override the toString method from superclass Task so the output can be reformatted.
* @return A string of [TaskType] Description (from: StartTime to: EndTime) is returned.
return "[" + shortType + "]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Parses the input line and execute respective commands.
* The command could include exit the program, list the tasks, mark and unmark a task,
* delete a task, and search for keywords.
* @param input The input to be parsed by the Parse class.
* @throws InvalidIndex If the index is invalid or out of bound.
public static void parse(String input) throws InvalidIndex {

System.out.println("Please key in a number after 'unmark'");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: " + description);
System.out.println("Now you have " + (taskList.getSize()) + " tasks in the list.");

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: " + description);
System.out.println("Now you have " + (taskList.getSize()) + " tasks in the list.");

System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("No matching tasks in the list. Please try again!");
// Constructor if needed for any initialization
* Load tasks stored in the txt file with a specified file path.
* If the file exist, reads every line and add into the taskList.
* @return A taskList containing all the tasks from the file.
* Save tasks added by the user to a file with specific relative path.
* @param taskList TaskList saved to the file.
* Construct a Task object which takes in description of the task.
* @param description The description of the task.

* Override the default toString method to restructure the format.

* Change the status icon according to its isDone status.
* @return The icon representing the completion of a task.
return (isDone ? "[X]" : "[ ]"); // mark done task with X

* @throws RepeatMark If the task is already marked as done.

* @throws RepeatUnmark If the task is already marked as not done.

public static Task fromString(String taskString) throws RepeatMark {
